DataElement.preferredName: Bone Scan Metastatic Disease Present Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine whether or not the existence of a tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site was observed on a nuclear imaging method used to evaluate pathological bone metabolism.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A nuclear imaging method used to evaluate pathological bone metabolism._A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A nuclear imaging method used to evaluate pathological bone metabolism.

Concepts.definition: A nuclear imaging method used to evaluate pathological bone metabolism.

Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
